title: Effect of Oxygen Concentration on Carbon Fixation

content.description:
Scientists investigated the effect of oxygen levels on the net rate of carbon fixation in two types of plants. The plants were grown in either well-watered soil (control) or dry soil and then exposed to either <math alttext="21%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> or <math alttext="1%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The net rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation for both types of plants was measured. Data are shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Figure 1. Net rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation in two types of plants grown in wet (control) or dry soil at <math alttext="21%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>
 Figure 2. Net rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation in two types of plants grown in wet (control) or dry soil at <math alttext="1%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>O</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>
content.question: Which of the following statements about the rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <msub> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> </msub> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> fixation in the two types of plants is supported by the data shown in the figures?

choices.label: At <math alttext="21%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, plant type <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has a lower rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation than plant type <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> does in both types of soil.

At <math alttext="1%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, plant type <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has a higher rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation than plant type <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> does in the dry soil but not in the control soil.

Plant types <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> have a statistically different rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation in both soil types at both oxygen levels.

The rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation is the same in both types of plants in the control soil at both oxygen levels.

content.answer: At <math alttext="21%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>21</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>O</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, plant type <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> has a lower rate of <math alttext="C O 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>CO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> fixation than plant type <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> does in both types of soil.

skill.text: 5.B: Use confidence intervals and error bars to estimate whether sample means are statistically different.
